_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The galaxy and the Great Brahmā (a causa: A galaxy with a thousand moons, suns, Sinerus king of mountains, Indias, Western Continents, Northern Continents, Eastern Continents, four thousand oceans, four thousand Great Kings, a thousand realms of the Gods of the Four Great Kings, a thousand realms of the Gods of the Thirty-Three, of the Gods of Yama, of the Joyful Gods, of the Gods who Love to Create, of the Gods who Control the Creations of Others, and a thousand Brahmā realms
The eight dimensions of mastery [an10.29: Perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly
Perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, red, with red color, red hue, and red tint
Not perceiving form internally and seeing visions externally, white, with white color, white hue, and white tint
The best of the convictions of outsiders: ‘I might not be, and it might not be mine. I will not be, and it will not be mine.’
The advocates of ultimate purity of the: Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, entering and remaining in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
